trans-unit.source: SQL Database Disaster Recovery Drills
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Disaster Recovery Drills

trans-unit.source: Learn guidance and best practices for using Azure SQL Database to perform disaster recovery drills that will help keep your mission critical business applications resilient to failures and outages.
trans-unit.target: Learn guidance and best practices for using Azure SQL Database to perform disaster recovery drills that will help keep your mission critical business applications resilient to failures and outages.

trans-unit.source: Performing Disaster Recovery Drill
trans-unit.target: Performing Disaster Recovery Drill

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that validation of application readiness for recovery workflow is performed periodically.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that validation of application readiness for recovery workflow is performed periodically.

trans-unit.source: Verifying the application behavior and implications of data loss and/or the disruption that failover involves is a good engineering practice.
trans-unit.target: Verifying the application behavior and implications of data loss and/or the disruption that failover involves is a good engineering practice.

trans-unit.source: It is also a requirement by most industry standards as part of business continuity certification.
trans-unit.target: It is also a requirement by most industry standards as part of business continuity certification.

trans-unit.source: Performing a disaster recovery drill consists of:
trans-unit.target: Performing a disaster recovery drill consists of:

trans-unit.source: Simulating data tier outage
trans-unit.target: Simulating data tier outage

trans-unit.source: Recovering
trans-unit.target: Recovering

trans-unit.source: Validate application integrity post recovery
trans-unit.target: Validate application integrity post recovery

trans-unit.source: Depending how you [design for business continuity](sql-database-business-continuity.md), the workflow to execute the drill can vary.
trans-unit.target: Depending how you [design for business continuity](sql-database-business-continuity.md), the workflow to execute the drill can vary.

trans-unit.source: Below we describe the best practices conducting a disaster recovery drill in the context of Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Below we describe the best practices conducting a disaster recovery drill in the context of Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore

trans-unit.source: To prevent the potential data loss when conducting a disaster recovery drill, we recommend performing the drill using a test environment by creating a copy of the production environment and using it to verify the application’s failover workflow.
trans-unit.target: To prevent the potential data loss when conducting a disaster recovery drill, we recommend performing the drill using a test environment by creating a copy of the production environment and using it to verify the application’s failover workflow.

trans-unit.source: Outage simulation
trans-unit.target: Outage simulation

trans-unit.source: Simulate the outage by either deleting or renaming the source database and cause application connectivity failure.
trans-unit.target: Simulate the outage by either deleting or renaming the source database and cause application connectivity failure.

trans-unit.source: This way you can validate outage detection/alerting and measure RTO for recovery duration.
trans-unit.target: This way you can validate outage detection/alerting and measure RTO for recovery duration.

trans-unit.source: Recovery
trans-unit.target: Recovery

trans-unit.source: Perform the Geo-Restore of the database into a different server as described [here](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md).
trans-unit.target: Perform the Geo-Restore of the database into a different server as described [here](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md).

trans-unit.source: Change the application configuration to connect to the recovered database(s) and follow the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide to complete the recovery.
trans-unit.target: Change the application configuration to connect to the recovered database(s) and follow the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide to complete the recovery.

trans-unit.source: Validation
trans-unit.target: Validation

trans-unit.source: Complete the drill by verifying the application integrity post recovery (i.e. connection strings, logins, basic functionality testing or other validations part of standard application signoffs procedures).
trans-unit.target: Complete the drill by verifying the application integrity post recovery (i.e. connection strings, logins, basic functionality testing or other validations part of standard application signoffs procedures).

trans-unit.source: Standard Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: Standard Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: A database that is protected using Standard Geo-Replication can only have one non-readable secondary database.
trans-unit.target: A database that is protected using Standard Geo-Replication can only have one non-readable secondary database.

trans-unit.source: The drill exercise will involve forced termination of the link, at which point the database will be unprotected.
trans-unit.target: The drill exercise will involve forced termination of the link, at which point the database will be unprotected.

trans-unit.source: Moreover, there is a possibility of data loss, so we don’t recommend customers to perform such test on production databases.
trans-unit.target: Moreover, there is a possibility of data loss, so we don’t recommend customers to perform such test on production databases.

trans-unit.source: Instead we recommend creating a copy of the production environment and using it to verify the application’s failover workflow.
trans-unit.target: Instead we recommend creating a copy of the production environment and using it to verify the application’s failover workflow.

trans-unit.source: Outage simulation
trans-unit.target: Outage simulation

trans-unit.source: Simulate workload on primary database.
trans-unit.target: Simulate workload on primary database.

trans-unit.source: If the primary is active at the time of termination data loss might occur, which will make the drill more realistic.
trans-unit.target: If the primary is active at the time of termination data loss might occur, which will make the drill more realistic.

trans-unit.source: Delete the primary database or [perform forced termination](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) of the link on the secondary database side.
trans-unit.target: Delete the primary database or [perform forced termination](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) of the link on the secondary database side.

trans-unit.source: Recovery
trans-unit.target: Recovery

trans-unit.source: Change the application configuration to connect to the former read-only secondary which will become fully accessible and the application can use it as the new primary.
trans-unit.target: Change the application configuration to connect to the former read-only secondary which will become fully accessible and the application can use it as the new primary.

trans-unit.source: Follow the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide to complete the recovery.
trans-unit.target: Follow the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide to complete the recovery.

trans-unit.source: Validation
trans-unit.target: Validation

trans-unit.source: Complete the drill by verifying the application integrity post recovery (i.e. connection strings, logins, basic functionality testing or other validations part of standard application signoffs procedures).
trans-unit.target: Complete the drill by verifying the application integrity post recovery (i.e. connection strings, logins, basic functionality testing or other validations part of standard application signoffs procedures).

trans-unit.source: Active Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: Active Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: The disaster recovery drill will be conducted by using a parallel target server and creating another set of read only secondaries in it.
trans-unit.target: The disaster recovery drill will be conducted by using a parallel target server and creating another set of read only secondaries in it.

trans-unit.source: A test version of the application tier should be used to verify the operation health and data integrity by running tests against that server after forced termination.
trans-unit.target: A test version of the application tier should be used to verify the operation health and data integrity by running tests against that server after forced termination.

trans-unit.source: Outage simulation
trans-unit.target: Outage simulation

trans-unit.source: [Create a new active geo-replication link](sql-database-business-continuity-design.md) from primary database to a secondary test server.
trans-unit.target: [Create a new active geo-replication link](sql-database-business-continuity-design.md) from primary database to a secondary test server.

trans-unit.source: If the primary is active at the time of termination the data loss might occur, which will make the drill more realistic.
trans-unit.target: If the primary is active at the time of termination the data loss might occur, which will make the drill more realistic.

trans-unit.source: [Perform forced termination](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) of the link on the secondary database which resides on the test server.
trans-unit.target: [Perform forced termination](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) of the link on the secondary database which resides on the test server.

trans-unit.source: Recovery
trans-unit.target: Recovery

trans-unit.source: Change the application configuration to connect to the former read only secondary which will become available for writes after termination.
trans-unit.target: Change the application configuration to connect to the former read only secondary which will become available for writes after termination.

trans-unit.source: Follow the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide to complete the recovery.
trans-unit.target: Follow the [Finalize a Recovered Database](sql-database-recovered-finalize.md) guide to complete the recovery.

trans-unit.source: Validation
trans-unit.target: Validation

trans-unit.source: Complete the drill by verifying the application integrity post recovery (i.e. connection strings, logins, basic functionality testing or other validations part of standard application signoffs procedures).
trans-unit.target: Complete the drill by verifying the application integrity post recovery (i.e. connection strings, logins, basic functionality testing or other validations part of standard application signoffs procedures).
